snippet: In the past, busloads of former detainees have attended a remembrance ceremony at the Granada War Relocation Center. But this year only two people who had lived there could make the trek.
abstract: Bob Fuchigami and Jane Okubo are the only former World War II detainees of Amache internment camp near Granada, Colo, who could make trip to remembrance ceremony; about 120,000 people of Japanese descent were sent to live in camps around country in early 1942; push is underway to finish museum honoring them.
lead_paragraph: In the past, busloads of former detainees have attended a remembrance ceremony at the Granada War Relocation Center. But this year only two people who had lived there could make the trek.

headline.main: Revisiting a World War II Internment Camp, as Others Try to Keep Its Story From Fading
headline.print_headline: Survivors Revisit War Internment Camp With a Story Others Hope to Preserve
